intro: Corydalis degensis, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Tibet and adjacent regions. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, spurred flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
